meanings.definition: A person who speaks with deliberate ambiguity or deception.
meanings.sent1: The doublespeaker confused everyone with his tricky words.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known as a doublespeaker for his unclear statements.
meanings.sent3: The doublespeaker at the party made everyone laugh with his sneaky language.
meanings.sent4: Her friend was a doublespeaker, always hiding the truth behind clever phrases.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the doublespeaker, for their words may not mean what they seem.

meanings.definition: To speak in a way that is intentionally misleading or confusing.
meanings.sent1: She doublespeaks to avoid telling the whole truth.
meanings.sent2: The scammer doublespeaks to trick people into giving money.
meanings.sent3: The child doublespeaking about eating vegetables was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: He doublespeaks like a magician, making reality disappear with his words.
meanings.sent5: The spy doublespeaks to keep his true intentions hidden from enemies.
